page.title: 09Huntindonshire Folklore
page.content: Folklore has developed over the ages, with each village having its own traditions and customs.These generally differed from village to village,as people rarely strayed further than their own village. Some of the expressions and customs of old Huntingdonshire (which is no longer a county) are remembered today. At Buckden School we still celebrate May Day with maypole dancing. Below are some of the expressions which are still used by our parents and grandparents. { } {Docky}: mid day lunch. {Bait} : food or a meal. {All round Bill's mother }: a long way round. {Kosh }: a pea pod. {Koshing }: podding peas.
